## GitHub Pages {{< iconify line-md:github-loop >}} 
<hr>

* Offers free hosting of static websites
* Easy to work together on projects/presentations
* Public repository needed if you do not have a premium account: attention with confidential data, api keysâ€¦ {{< iconify line-md:alert-circle-loop >}} 
* [GitHub Actions](https://quarto.org/docs/publishing/github-pages.html#github-action) gives possibility to render Quarto documents automatically after e.g. every commit 

. . . 

There are many other [alternatives](https://quarto.org/docs/publishing/) available!

Name of the repository will be also in the domain of your published site.

## Fill your repository
<hr>

:::{style='font-size: 30px'}
1. Way: Use git (you can prevent the upload of files using a `.gitignore` file)
:::

```{mermaid}
flowchart LR
 A[git init] --> B[git add .]
  B --> C[git commit -m 'Initial commit']
  C --> D[git branch -M main]
  D --> E[git remote add origin UrlToYourRepository.git]
  E --> F[git push origin main]
```

:::{style='font-size: 30px'}
2. Way: manual upload of your files (in our case these needed are `images/`, `index_files/` and `index.html`)
:::

![](images/screenshots/upload_manually.png){width="60%" fig-align="center"}

## Publish your page
<hr>

```{mermaid}
flowchart LR
 A[Settings of your repository] --> B[Pages]
  B --> C[Select branch with index.html]
```
